name: Hotel Palazzo Alexander

reviews.title: Fantastic Stay at Palazzo Alexander
reviews.text: Palazzo Alexander is an elegant, boutique hotel well-located in Lucca. The suites are all named after operas composed by Giacomo Puccini, who was born and lived in Lucca.

Our suite was "Madama Butterfly" and it was decorated in white and gold with a wood parquet floor. The room was huge (even by American standards) and the bathroom was large. The windows were well-placed and gave us a cross breeze when sleeping.
reviews.title: Lovely relaxed cosy hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As soon as we walked through the foyer into this hotel there were red flags flying! It was gaudy, dirty and old. Not old in the charming antique way, just run down old. The staff was friendly, but that is where the positive ends. We were shown to our room and the smell hit us like a ton of bricks. Personally, I was gagging. We immediatley threw open the windows and saw we were overlooking the dirty street, witha garbage smell .....lovely.
reviews.title: Somewhere between a three (3) and four (4)... .

There was no where else to go as hotels were booked, and we were only going to be ther 2 nights, thank God. We survived that becasue we were never there unless to sleep and then on departure day were up and at about 5 a.m.
reviews.title: We loved it

reviews.text: NOT A GOOD CHOICE!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Palazzo Alexander is a very well situated property and, despite the horror stories of driving through the city gates and finding the place, we located the hotel fairly easy. So, the location is very central. The hotel is also reasonably priced, so here is another plus. Breakfast is plentiful with a good selection of cheeses, cold cuts, and breads, as well as the standard cold cereal, yogurt, juice, coffee and tea. All of the above add to a solid four (4) bubble review.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Palazzo Alexander for 10 nights at end Jan beginning feb 2008. Apart from taxi driver from Pisa airport getting terribly lost on arriving in Lucca, the hotel is situated in a superb location in side street, which leads to main streets of the centre. So quiet that ,although narrow roads run alongside (and I mean narrow!) once in our room we heard nothing. Very comfortable bed, and whils't I note the comments of a previous review about the room being dark, we were always shattered after busy days out "exploring" surrounding areas and enjoyed the peace and quiet of a good nights sleep. The hotel is only about 5 minutes from main bus station (which is quite small and just within city walls) and we took bus when we left to return to Pisa which at only 5 euros was a lot cheaper than taxi (the buses run approx every hour) Although a lot of restaurants were closed whilst we were there, we still had a great choice and didn't manage to get around to visiting all on our list. We were always happy to return to Lucca and the hotel and visited many places in our time there, including Siena ,Viarregio, Cinque Terra, all accessible by bus and train station for destinations further afield. Train station is approx 15 minutes walk from hotel along city walls. Mario, Franco and the rest of the staff at the Palazzo Alexander are extremely friendly and helpful and will do their utmost to help and assist you with anything they can to make sure your stay is as comfortable and stress free as possible. The bar Stella Polare situated on the corner of the Piazza Napoleone is a fantasic place to enjoy a wonderful glass of wine (many to choose from and served in beautiful glasses) or a beer coffee etc. There is also a wonderful restaurant located on the first floor, where we enjoyed a very pleasant lunch, all freshly cooked on the premises. We found this place to be our bolthole each day on our return to Lucca from our "adventures" before going back to the hotel to get changed. I cannot say enough in favour of these lovely people and Lucca as a wonderful place to stay....regardless of the weather!. we spent the last night in Pisa and to be perfectly honest wished we hadn't bothered..after checking out leaning tower and walk along river we found it quite tacky and boring. Nothing like what we had experienced and we felt we had cheated ourselves out of another great night in Lucca! Thank you to everyone we met for making our visit so fantastically memorable!
reviews.title: Great Location Fantastic Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, after reading other reviews on Trip Advisor, Palazzo Alexander seems the lesser of several evils - maybe I expect too much. I've stayed in many hotels ranging from 2 stars to 5 star luxury and this was not as pleasant as one of the 2 star hotels I have stayed in.
reviews.title: Miss Havisham's house??

reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay!

reviews.text: There was no coffee-making facilities in the room (odd bearing in mind the large numbers of English visitors to Lucca who would automatically expect this). There were 2 oranges, however, which struck me as odd. Minibar ok but we didn't use it.
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the bathroom was a wierd potpourri type dish with green bathsalts?? and dusty flowerheads (all a bit voodoo) and I couldn't see the point. There was a gap between the shelf over the sink and the sink itself which seemd not to have been cleaned in a very long time and this made me question the cleanliness in other aspects of the hotel. I didn't go looking for dirt - I saw it when I bent forward to clean my teeth!
reviews.title: Lucca - a lovely quiet City close to Pisa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: Excellent Value Accommodation

reviews.text: Its not a five star hotel but it does provide excellent vale for money. In adition, Lucca makes a great base to explore Tuscany and further afield with excellent rail links. I would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel or staying there again in the future.
reviews.title: Very, VERY happy at the Palazzo-Alexander. Lucca

reviews.title: The most charming hotel in Lucca
absolutely fabulous
reviews.text: Arriving in Lucca late afternoon by car, we were delighted when Maximilian from the hotel escorted us to their car park. We didn’t use/need our car during our three night stay as we explored the narrow streets and stretched our legs around the Renaissance walls. In fact the locals use bicycles and there are very few cars in this old part of the town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated in the heart of the town within easy walking distance of a variety of restaurants, shops and of course the churches – just 87 of them.
reviews.title: VEry nice

description: Known today as the Hotel Palazzo Alexander, the residence encompasses four floors of rooms and junior suites, all with modern, private bathrooms-some with whirlpool baths. In addition, all rooms contain such conveniences as air conditioning, satellite television, telephones, computer hook-ups, safe, minibar, hairdryers and free of charge wi-fi connection.The décor of the residence reflects the noble Lucchese style with the use of antique wood floors in all the bedrooms and fine marble and other local stones in the bathrooms, lobby and common rooms. Located in the center of Lucca’s historic district, Palazzo Alexander is easily reached from the main highway exits and from local train and bus stations.
